message.content:
Since the time it took to dry 10 pairs of socks was 10 hours, we can assume that each pair of socks takes the same amount of time to dry. 

If Tom has 7 pairs of socks instead of 10 pairs, and given that the drying time for one pair is the same, we would calculate the total drying time by simply multiplying the time taken for one pair (which is 10 hours) by the number of pairs.

So, 10 pairs require a total of 10 * 10 = 100 hours to dry. 

Therefore, seven pairs of socks under the same weather conditions will also take 7 * 10 = <<7*10=70>>70 hours to dry completely. Answer: \boxed{70}.
